00051 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;
00052 
00053 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({          \
00054     unsigned long long _ull = (ull);            \
00055     (l) = _ull & 0xffffffff;                    \
00056     (h) = _ull >> 32;                           \
00057 })
00058 
00059 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({             \
00060     unsigned long long _ull;                    \
00061     asm ( "": "=A"(_ull) : "d"(h), "a"(l));     \
00062     _ull;                                       \
00063 })
00064 
00065 /* Fast longs multiplication. */
00066 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00067 rthal_ullmul(unsigned long m1, unsigned long m2) {
00068     /* Gcc (at least for versions 2.95 and higher) optimises correctly here. */
00069     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00070 }
00071 
00072 /* const helper for rthal_uldivrem, so that the compiler will eliminate
00073    multiple calls with same arguments, at no additionnal cost. */
00074 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00075 __rthal_uldivrem(const unsigned long long ull, const unsigned long d) {
00076 
00077     unsigned long long ret;
00078     __asm__ ("divl %1" : "=A,A"(ret) : "r,?m"(d), "A,A"(ull));
00079     /* Exception if quotient does not fit on unsigned long. */
00080     return ret;
00081 }
00082 
00083 static inline __attribute_const__ int rthal_imuldiv (const int i,
00084                                                      const int mult,
00085                                                      const int div) {
00086 
00087     /* Returns (unsigned)i =
00088                (unsigned long long)i*(unsigned)(mult)/(unsigned)div. */
00089     const unsigned long ui = (const unsigned long) i;
00090     const unsigned long um = (const unsigned long) mult;
00091     return __rthal_uldivrem((const unsigned long long) ui * um, div);
00092 }
00093 
00094 /* Fast long long division: when the quotient and remainder fit on 32 bits.
00095    Recent compilers remove redundant calls to this function. */
00096 static inline unsigned long rthal_uldivrem(unsigned long long ull,
00097                                            const unsigned long d,
00098                                            unsigned long *const rp) {
00099 
00100     unsigned long q, r;
00101     ull = __rthal_uldivrem(ull, d);
00102     __asm__ ( "": "=d"(r), "=a"(q) : "A"(ull));
00103     if(rp)
00104         *rp = r;
00105     return q;
00106 }
00107 
00108 
00109 /* Division of an unsigned 96 bits ((h << 32) + l) by an unsigned 32 bits.
00110    Common building block for ulldiv and llimd. */
00111 static inline unsigned long long __rthal_div96by32 (const unsigned long long h,
00112                                                     const unsigned long l,
00113                                                     const unsigned long d,
00114                                                     unsigned long *const rp) {
00115 
00116     u_long rh;
00117     const u_long qh = rthal_uldivrem(h, d, &rh);
00118     const unsigned long long t = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, l);
00119     const u_long ql = rthal_uldivrem(t, d, rp);
00120 
00121     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00122 }
00123 
00124 
00125 /* Slow long long division. Uses rthal_uldivrem, hence has the same property:
00126    the compiler removes redundant calls. */
00127 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (const unsigned long long ull,
00128                                                const unsigned long d,
00129                                                unsigned long *const rp) {
00130 
00131     unsigned long h, l;
00132     __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l);
00133     return __rthal_div96by32(h, l, d, rp);
00134 }
00135 
00136 /* Replaced the helper with rthal_ulldiv. */
00137 #define rthal_u64div32c rthal_ulldiv
00138 
00139 static inline __attribute_const__
00140 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00141                                    const unsigned long m,
00142                                    const unsigned long d) {
00143 
00144     unsigned long long th, tl;
00145     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll;
00146 
00147     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00148     tl = (unsigned long long) opl * m;
00149     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00150     th = (unsigned long long) oph * m;
00151     /* op * m == ((th + tlh) << 32) + tll */
00152 
00153     __asm__ (  "addl %1, %%eax\n\t"
00154                "adcl $0, %%edx"
00155                : "=A,A"(th)
00156                : "r,?m"(tlh), "A,A"(th) );
00157     /* op * m == (th << 32) + tll */
00158 
00159     return __rthal_div96by32(th, tll, d, NULL);
00160 }
00161 
00162 static inline __attribute_const__ long long rthal_llimd (const long long op,
00163                                                          const unsigned long m,
00164                                                          const unsigned long d) {
00165 
00166     if(op < 0LL)
00167         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00168     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00169 }
00170 
00171 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00172     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00173     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00174             : "=r,r" (ul)
00175             : "r,?m"  (ul));
00176     return ul;
00177 }

00218 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the
00219    Xenomai domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task
00220    address using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack
00221    pointer instead. */
00222 
00223 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00224     u_long stack = (u_long)rthal_root_domain->esp[cpuid] & ~(THREAD_SIZE - 1);
00225     return ((struct thread_info *)(stack))->task;
00226 }
00227 
00228 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00229 {
00230     int *esp;
00231 
00232     __asm__ ("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r,?m" (esp));
00233 
00234     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00235         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00236 
00237     return get_current();
00238 }
00239 
00240 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE || CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00241 
00242 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid)
00243 {
00244     return current;
00245 }
00246 
00247 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00248 {
00249     return current;
00250 }

00264 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00265 {
00266     unsigned long flags;
00267 
00268     rthal_local_irq_save_hw(flags);
00269 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00270     if (!delay) {
00271         /* Kick the timer interrupt immediately. */
00272         rthal_trigger_irq(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI);
00273     } else {
00274     /* Note: reading before writing just to work around the Pentium
00275        APIC double write bug. apic_read_around() expands to nil
00276        whenever CONFIG_X86_GOOD_APIC is set. --rpm */
00277     apic_read_around(APIC_LVTT);
00278     apic_write_around(APIC_LVTT,RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_VECTOR);
00279     apic_read_around(APIC_TMICT);
00280     apic_write_around(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00281     }
00282 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00283     if (!delay)
00284         rthal_trigger_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00285     else {
00286         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00287         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00288     }
00289 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00290     rthal_local_irq_restore_hw(flags);
00291 }
